name: liberated
content:
liberated adjective
(FREE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
released from a prison or a place where you have been kept : The seven liberated prisoners were hailed as heroes by the American public. The regiment was composed mainly of newly liberated slaves.
A liberated place is one where the people in it have been given their freedom: The footage was taken at a liberated concentration camp. He believed that the newly liberated countries should stick together.

liberated adjective
(NOT LIMITED)
no longer having any limits or controls: No longer bound by a strict schedule of training and competing, she felt liberated. When I dance I feel liberated, like I've left a heavy load behind.

liberated adjective
(NOT TRADITIONAL)
not following traditional ways of behaving or old ideas: She's chosen career advancement instead of having children - does that make her a liberated woman? Scandinavia has some of the most liberated and tolerant countries in Europe. Synonym
emancipated
